intro: Synnema pinnatifidum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf synnema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Celastraceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and opposite, pinnately divided leaves. The leaves are typically green and have a serrated or lobed margin, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It produces small, inconspicuous yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by small, fleshy fruits. This plant is often found in moist, shaded environments and is adapted to thrive in humid climates.
